Content:
A simple file explorer that was born because I wanted to learn the Rust language.
It is operating system independent and trimmed for optimization.



The performance is provided by ["jwalk"](https://crates.io/crates/jwalk/versions) and ["Tauri"](https://tauri.app/).

CoDriver does not use path caching to access files and folders, so the performance is achieved by Rust, the speed of the disk and the power of the cpu. â‰ï¸ Keep in mind that this software is still work in progress and will contain bugs!

# Links - Basic features

# ãƒªãƒ³ã‚¯ - åŸºæœ¬æ©Ÿèƒ½

RowTranslations.originContent: A simple file explorer that was born because I wanted to learn the Rust language.
It is operating system independent and trimmed for optimization.
The performance is provided by ["jwalk"](https://crates.io/crates/jwalk/versions) and ["Tauri"](https://tauri.app/).
CoDriver does not use path caching to access files and folders, so the performance is achieved by Rust, the speed of the disk and the power of the cpu.
â‰ï¸ Keep in mind that this software is still work in progress and will contain bugs!

Content:
- Advanced features - Dependencies - FTP implementation (SSHFS) - Language support - Known issues - Todos - User interface - Speed comparison
## Basic features - Navigate through directories as you know it - Copy & Paste, delete, create and rename files and folders - Switch between "big buttons"-, list and miller columns mode - Close popups with esc - Jump to a directory with Ctrl / Cmd + G by inputting a path - Sort items in list mode by size, name or last modified
## Advanced features - Compress files and folders - zip - Unpack archives automatically into a new folder in the working directory - rar - zip - 7zip - tar (.gz, .bz2) - Navigate to a directory using the shortcut LAlt + 1 / 2 / 3 | (macOS option + 1 / 2 / 3) - Configure the paths yourself in the settings - Create file with F6 - Create folder with F7 - Start typing in a directory to instantly filter dir entries - Dual-Pane view - Search for files with F8 - Copy current selected element to other pane with F5 - Move current selected element to other pane with LShift + F5 - Drag and drop files into the explorer to copy them into the current directory - Multi rename your selection with Ctrl / Cmd + LShift + M - Run multi rename with Ctrl / Cmd + Return - File quick preview -> Select directory entry and tap the space bar.

RowTranslations.originContent: - Navigate through directories as you know it
- Copy & Paste, delete, create and rename files and folders
- Switch between "big buttons"-, list and miller columns mode
- Jump to a directory with Ctrl / Cmd + G by inputting a path
- Sort items in list mode by size, name or last modified
- Unpack archives automatically into a new folder in the working directory
- Navigate to a directory using the shortcut LAlt + 1 / 2 / 3 | (macOS option + 1 / 2 / 3)
- Configure the paths yourself in the settings
- Start typing in a directory to instantly filter dir entries
- Copy current selected element to other pane with F5
- Move current selected element to other pane with LShift + F5
- Drag and drop files into the explorer to copy them into the current directory
- Multi rename your selection with Ctrl / Cmd + LShift + M
- Run multi rename with Ctrl / Cmd + Return
- File quick preview -> Select directory entry and tap the space bar.

Content:
- Supported files: all image files (.jpg, .png, ...), .pdf, .mp4, .json, .txt, .html - All other items will show a small tile with some information about it. (path, size, last modified) - Instant navigation -> Start typing and automatically filter the directory entries making it sometimes
much faster to navigate to a desired location

Content:
```
sudo apt update
sudo apt install libwebkit2gtk-4.0-dev \
    build-essential \
    curl \
    wget \
    file \
    libssl-dev \
    libgtk-3-dev \
    libayatana-appindicator3-dev \
    librsvg2-dev
```

Content:
```
sudo dnf check-update
sudo dnf install openssl1.1 \
    webkit2gtk4.0-devel \
    openssl-devel \
    curl \
    wget \
    file \
    libappindicator-gtk3-devel \
    librsvg2-devel
sudo dnf group install "C Development Tools and Libraries"
```

```
    librsvg2-devel

```

## ğŸ´â€â˜ ï¸ Language Support - English - Option to choose between languages coming soon ...
## âš ï¸ Known issues: - Drag and drop out of the window is currently not working on linux - On windows you may have to install [Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/cpp/windows/latest-supported-vc-redist?view=msvc-170) - Permissions on ms-windows are a little bit strange - You may have to run the program as administrator if you encounter problems to copy elements or something similar - There could be a problem you need to install openssl1.1 on linux systems, when the program does not start - ~~Tabs are not fully worked out yet~~
## ğŸ“ Todos: - Multiple languages - Favorites - Access online storage services (Google drive, etc.)

## How to contribute Setup your machine for developing tauri v1 applications: [Tauri prerequisites](https://tauri.app/v1/guides/getting-started/prerequisites)

When this is done just do ```git clone https://github.com/RickyDane/CoDriver``` or ```gh repo clone RickyDane/CoDriver``` in a location on your machine.

You should be able to run ```cargo tauri dev``` in the root directory of this project to start building and running CoDriver.
Be sure to have tauri-cli installed: ```cargo install tauri-cli```

## Star History #### ãã®ä»–ã®ã‚µãƒ¼ãƒ‰ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ãƒ†ã‚£ã‚½ãƒ•ãƒˆã‚¦ã‚§ã‚¢ - DragSelect (https://github.com/ThibaultJanBeyer/DragSelect)

RowTranslations.originContent: Setup your machine for developing tauri v1 applications: [Tauri prerequisites](https://tauri.app/v1/guides/getting-started/prerequisites)
When this is done just do ```git clone https://github.com/RickyDane/CoDriver``` or ```gh repo clone RickyDane/CoDriver``` in a location on your machine.

RowTranslations.originContent: You should be able to run ```cargo tauri dev``` in the root directory of this project to start building and running CoDriver.
Be sure to have tauri-cli installed: ```cargo install tauri-cli```
